result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M. Aide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Remit fines and costs, with exception of DNA surcharge and $320 buy money--to be taken from bond on deposit

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Absolute sobriety-no alcohol, illegal drugs, or controlled susbtances without a valid prescritpion, taken only as prescribed, and as approved by agent.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent.
Def must submit DNA sample on 12-15-16

superTimeConds.notes: Community service as determined by agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
